item.title: Need A Happiness Boost? Spend Your Money To Buy Time, Not More Stuff
item.description: August 28, 2017 - A recent study suggests that when people spend their extra cash to get help with time-consuming chores, they're likelier to feel better than if they use the money to buy more things.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 28, 2017 - A recent study suggests that when people spend their extra cash to get help with time-consuming chores, they're likelier to feel better than if they use the money to buy more things. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/28/545839192/need-a-happiness-boost-spend-your-money-to-buy-time-not-more-stuff

item.title: Serious Nursing Home Abuse Often Not Reported To Police, Federal Investigators Find
item.description: August 28, 2017 - Despite legal requirements, more than one-quarter of cases of severe abuse that were uncovered by government investigators were not reported to the police. The majority involved sexual assault.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 28, 2017 - Despite legal requirements, more than one-quarter of cases of severe abuse that were uncovered by government investigators were not reported to the police. The majority involved sexual assault. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/28/546460187/serious-nursing-home-abuse-often-not-reported-to-police-federal-investigators-fi

item.title: Red Cross Update On Hurricane Harvey Relief Efforts
item.description: August 27, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Brad Kieserman, the Red Cross vice president of disaster operations and logistics, who is running the Harvey relief efforts.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 27, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Brad Kieserman, the Red Cross vice president of disaster operations and logistics, who is running the Harvey relief efforts. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/27/546603340/red-cross-update-on-hurricane-harvey-relief-efforts

item.title: What The Public Is Saying About Miscarriage In 140 Characters
item.description: August 27, 2017 - Miscarriage, while widely experienced, is not often discussed in public. Researchers have turned to social media to see what people are saying about the topic and how much they're choosing to share.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 27, 2017 - Miscarriage, while widely experienced, is not often discussed in public. Researchers have turned to social media to see what people are saying about the topic and how much they're choosing to share. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/27/542809414/what-the-public-is-saying-about-miscarriage-in-140-characters

item.title: What's Making These Dogs In Mumbai Turn Blue?
item.description: August 26, 2017 - Five dogs with this unusual hue were found in an industrial area of Mumbai. The hunt for its cause revealed a much bigger problem.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 26, 2017 - Five dogs with this unusual hue were found in an industrial area of Mumbai. The hunt for its cause revealed a much bigger problem. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/26/546049293/whats-making-these-dogs-in-mumbai-turn-blue

item.title: Having A Best Friend In Your Teenage Years Could Benefit You For Life
item.description: August 26, 2017 - Researchers have found that people with deep friendships in adolescence had less anxiety and a greater sense of self-worth in early adulthood. Close friends matter, their study found.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 26, 2017 - Researchers have found that people with deep friendships in adolescence had less anxiety and a greater sense of self-worth in early adulthood. Close friends matter, their study found. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/26/543739986/having-a-best-friend-in-your-teenage-years-could-benefit-you-for-life

item.title: 4 Steps That Could Cut Health Insurance Premiums And Boost Enrollment
item.description: August 25, 2017 - For now, the Affordable Care Act remains the law of the land. A consulting firm lays out four steps it says would lead to insurance coverage for millions more, at a lower cost.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 25, 2017 - For now, the Affordable Care Act remains the law of the land. A consulting firm lays out four steps it says would lead to insurance coverage for millions more, at a lower cost. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/25/546141203/four-steps-that-could-cut-health-insurance-premiums-and-boost-enrollment

item.title: This Music Teacher Played His Saxophone While In Brain Surgery
item.description: August 25, 2017 - The surgeons tasked with removing a tumor from Dan Fabbio's brain had worked hard not to disrupt his ability to perform music. They rejoiced when he was able to play his sax on the operating table.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 25, 2017 - The surgeons tasked with removing a tumor from Dan Fabbio's brain had worked hard not to disrupt his ability to perform music. They rejoiced when he was able to play his sax on the operating table. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/25/545710598/this-music-teacher-played-his-saxophone-while-in-brain-surgery

item.title: A Day Camp That Teaches Kids In The U.S. About Female Genital Mutilation
item.description: August 25, 2017 - There's a nature walk, a drum performance, a picnic lunch — and speakers who tell the youngsters about the harm caused by the practice.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 25, 2017 - There's a nature walk, a drum performance, a picnic lunch — and speakers who tell the youngsters about the harm caused by the practice. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/25/545002991/a-day-camp-that-teaches-kids-in-the-u-s-about-female-genital-mutilation

item.title: Aetna Mailer Accidentally Reveals HIV Status Of Up To 12,000 Customers
item.description: August 25, 2017 - "Aetna's privacy violation devastated people whose neighbors and family learned their intimate health information," a legal group representing customers says. Aetna calls its mistake "unacceptable."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 25, 2017 - "Aetna's privacy violation devastated people whose neighbors and family learned their intimate health information," a legal group representing customers says. Aetna calls its mistake "unacceptable." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/25/546048615/aetna-mailer-accidentally-reveals-hiv-status-of-up-to-12-000-patients

item.title: Moshe Szyf: How Do Our Experiences Rewire Our Brains And Bodies?
item.description: August 25, 2017 - Many think genetic makeup is fixed from the moment we're born. But Moshe Szyf says this understanding is incomplete because our experiences and environment have the power to change our basic biology.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 25, 2017 - Many think genetic makeup is fixed from the moment we're born. But Moshe Szyf says this understanding is incomplete because our experiences and environment have the power to change our basic biology. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/25/545092951/moshe-szyf-how-do-our-experiences-rewire-our-brains-and-bodies

item.title: Nadine Burke Harris: How Does Trauma Affect A Child's DNA?
item.description: August 25, 2017 - Pediatrician Nadine Burke Harris found an unsettling trend when examining patients at her clinic: trauma. She found that adversity can change a child's biology and result in severe health outcomes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 25, 2017 - Pediatrician Nadine Burke Harris found an unsettling trend when examining patients at her clinic: trauma. She found that adversity can change a child's biology and result in severe health outcomes. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/25/545092982/nadine-burke-harris-how-does-trauma-affect-a-childs-dna

item.title: After A Suicide, Sibling Survivors Are Often Overlooked
item.description: August 25, 2017 - Recent studies show that people who survive a brother or sister's suicide are at great risk of mood disorders and mental health problems, including thoughts of harming themselves.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 25, 2017 - Recent studies show that people who survive a brother or sister's suicide are at great risk of mood disorders and mental health problems, including thoughts of harming themselves. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/25/545554065/after-a-suicide-sibling-survivors-are-often-overlooked

item.title: Is The Secret To A Healthier Microbiome Hidden In The Hadza Diet?
item.description: August 24, 2017 - Some species of bacteria in our intestines are disappearing. Can we reverse the microbial die-off? The food eaten by Tanzania's Hadza tribe could hold the answer.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 24, 2017 - Some species of bacteria in our intestines are disappearing. Can we reverse the microbial die-off? The food eaten by Tanzania's Hadza tribe could hold the answer. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/24/545631521/is-the-secret-to-a-healthier-microbiome-hidden-in-the-hadza-diet

item.title: A Retired Marine And A Photojournalist Confront War's 'Invisible Injuries'
item.description: August 24, 2017 - Marine Sgt. TJ Brennan suffered from memory loss after being injured by a grenade in Afghanistan in 2010. Finbarr O'Reilly captured the event on film. Now the two men have written a memoir.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 24, 2017 - Marine Sgt. TJ Brennan suffered from memory loss after being injured by a grenade in Afghanistan in 2010. Finbarr O'Reilly captured the event on film. Now the two men have written a memoir. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/24/545705213/a-retired-marine-and-a-photojournalist-confront-wars-invisible-injuries
